intro: Anthericum serpentinum, commonly known as the serpentine anthericum, is a rare and specialized plant that thrives in nutrient-poor, calcareous soils. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its striking, arrow-shaped leaves and unique inflorescence. The plant's growth is closely associated with specific geological substrates, particularly serpentine rock formations. Its botanical adaptations include a reduced root system and specialized leaf structures to cope with harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable indicator species for ecological studies.
